\[

 Specifically, if the first house is colored in one of 3 ways, then the second house has 2 choices, and the third house has 2 choices (it cannot be the same color as the second house), and so on. This gives us the recurrence relation:
\[ a_n = 2a_{n-1} \]
with the initial condition \( a_1 = 3 \) (since there are 3 possible colors for a single house).

We can now compute the values of \( a_n \) up to \( n = 10 \):
\[
\begin{aligned}
a_1 &= 3, \\
a_2 &= 2a_1 = 2 \cdot 3 = 6, \\
